intro: Coprosma tahitensis var. raiateensis, commonly known as the Raiatea coprosma, is a shrub native to the Society Islands of French Polynesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries that are edible. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
